newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia opens sterile fruit fly factory.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia opens sterile fruit fly factory.

text.p: Australia's opening of a A$600,000 facility capable of producing 20 million sterile fruit fly a week heralded a new era in protection of A$500 million worth of annual fresh fruit and vegetable exports, New South Wales (NSW) state Agriculture Minister Richard Amery said on Monday.

The fruit fly factory, at a New South Wales government facility at Camden, would produce sterile fruit fly for release in the major fruit growing areas of New South Wales, Victoria and South Austarlia, Amery said. Fruit flies were the most destructive horticultural pests in the world, he said.
The facility had the potential to steadily replace pesticides as a field control in many areas, Amery said.
Sterile fruit fly are to be released at the rate of about 100 for every wild fruit fly in the Fruit Fly Exclusion Zone in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia.
Wild fruit fly were therefore most likely to mate with a sterile partner, Amery said.
